title: Add dedicated title page with app/owner hero and gallery navigation

requirements.summary: Make the app open on a dedicated title page at route "/" showing app name and owner name in English.
acceptanceCriteria: When the app loads, the first screen shown is the title page at route "/" (not the gallery).
The title page shows the app name "ANIMEXIS" prominently.
The title page shows the owner name prominently (not only in the footer) in English (e.g., "Created by Ashwath").

file_operations.description: Update client-side routing so initial render honors "/" as the default title page (instead of defaulting to "/gallery"), and keep "/gallery" reachable via navigation; ensure the displayed view matches the browser path and updates the path on navigation.

requirements.summary: Extend the existing letter-by-letter title component to render both the app name and an owner-name line, with reduced-motion-safe behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: The title ("ANIMEXIS") still renders with the existing letter-by-letter reveal behavior (or an equivalent reduced-motion-safe presentation).
The owner name line renders as part of the hero/title block (not only the footer) and is visible without scrolling.
If the user prefers reduced motion, both lines appear without animated reveal.

file_operations.description: Add support for rendering a second line for the owner (e.g., "Created by Ashwath") as part of the hero/title block; keep the existing letter-by-letter animation for the main title while ensuring that when reduced motion is preferred, both lines render immediately without animated reveal.

requirements.summary: Add an explicit, non-scroll-gated UI affordance on the title page to navigate to the gallery at "/gallery".
acceptanceCriteria: From the title page, the user can navigate to the gallery via an explicit UI affordance (e.g., a subtle text link/button).
Navigation does not require scrolling/touch gestures to unlock/enter the gallery.
After navigating to the gallery, the gallery behaves as it does today.

file_operations.description: Add a clearly visible, explicit navigation control (button/link) within the hero area that calls the provided onNavigate and routes the user to "/gallery" without any scroll-to-enter gating; keep all user-facing text in English.
Wire the title-page navigation control to update the active route to "/gallery" and reflect it in the browser path, without introducing any scroll-based gating behavior.
